alert.note: Alert for Osage (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 29 at 9:54PM CDT until March 30 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Osage County in east central Kansas... * Until 100 AM CDT. * At 951 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. At 9:50 PM the sheriff reported roads were closed near Burlingame including US 56 highway and old 75 highway. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Osage City, Carbondale, Overbrook, Burlingame, Scranton and Reading. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
